ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you told your mother/ closest female guardian/parent 1 that you are not heterosexual?
How tolerant is your mother/closest female guardian/ parent 1 toward your sexual orientation currently
Notes: 1 = Completely tolerant and accepting; 2 = Mostly tolerant and accepting; 3 = Somewhat tolerant and accepting; 4 = Neither accepting nor rejecting; 5= Somewhat hostile and rejecting; 6 = Mostly hostile and rejecting; 7 = Completely hostile and rejecting

ElementDescription: Have you told your father/ closest male guardian/ parent 2 that you are not heterosexual?
How tolerant is your father/closest male guardian/ parent 2 toward your sexual orientation currently?
Notes: 1 = Completely tolerant and accepting; 2 = Mostly tolerant and accepting; 3 = Somewhat tolerant and accepting; 4 = Neither accepting nor rejecting; 5= Somewhat hostile and rejecting; 6 = Mostly hostile and rejecting; 7 = Completely hostile and rejecting

ElementDescription: Parental Attitudes Toward Child's Sexual Orientation Score
Notes: Average of Maternal and Paternal attitude score
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime
